channel.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
channel.description: I was thinking of getting a Xbox 360 controller to my computer. How do you think it would be to games like black ops 2? Worth it? No? Yes? Thanks..? (:

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

I would use a controller for FPS if I could, just because I’m used to using it. I just bought a computer capable of playing games about a week ago, so have no experience using a mouse and keyboard for games. But I’m sure people who have been using a mouse and keyboard for a while would dominate me and my controller in any game.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Some games sure, but for first person shooter a mouse/keyboard is always going to be more accurate.

Whether or not the user is proficient enough with a mouse/keyboard and a controller to make a comparison, well that’s another story.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

You’d benefit from having one even if you were a mouse/keyboard gamer. For example, let’s say you’re going to emulate a console game, like Metroid Prime and Dolphin didn’t support using a mouse. Well, you could easily just use the 360 controller and it would make the experience so much better. Another example is I have a USB SNES controller I use for playing older console games and while I could easily just use the keyboard, it makes the games funner and actually simpler to play.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I would use mouse and keyboard for pretty much everything besides driving games

item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I prefer using the mouse and keyboard on certain PC games (like Just Cause 2), but not for other games like Black Ops zombies.

Read full topic

I’d get a controller anyway for emulators.

item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Controllers are more comfortable. Mouse and keyboard are difficult when you’re a competitive gamer and you start spamming keys and shit.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Getting good with a mouse and keyboard takes longer generally than a controller however the mouse and keyboard are better factually and from my own personal experience I would verify that as true.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:11, topic:516516”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=634777.msg4284260#msg4284260 date=1366132935]
Personal preference is stupid to debate.
[/quote]
Nonetheless, he asked if it’s worth getting, which is personal preference. Facts are basically useless in this situation.[/quote]
In that case. If OP has an xbox, he/she should invest in a wired xbox controller. It can be used on the PC by downloading some software by microsoft, and worse comes to worse. you can use it in your xbox still.
The wireless ones don’t do the same, even if you have a charger cable hooked into it. You have to buy a $20 (last I saw) component for the computer so it can sync.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:9, topic:516516”]Just because it has been proven that a mouse is more accurate than a controller doesn’t mean that it can’t be debated. People have different opinions, making it debatable.

Edit: The OP does not ask anything about which is more accurate.[/quote]

I was actually joking about it being proven (hence the Illuminati reference). I do think that most people would agree with the Mouse position though.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

I used to use a controller until I got the hang of using a keyboard and mouse; as said, now trying to use a controller feels weird to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Just because it has been proven that a mouse is more accurate than a controller doesn’t mean that it can’t be debated. People have different opinions, making it debatable.

Edit: The OP does not ask anything about which is more accurate.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:7, topic:516516”][quote author=Teem_Rocket link=topic=634777.msg4284217#msg4284217 date=1366129150]
How is this even a debate? Mouse pointing is SO much more accurate than joysticks.
[/quote]
It’s a personal preference, that’s how it’s debatable. If I were being forced to use a mouse rather than a controller, my K/D ratio on Black Ops 2 would most likely be around a 1.25 or so, and right now it’s 2.07.[/quote]

It’s a fact… It’s been proven in a highly sophisticated state-of-the-art underground sooper sekret Illuminati testing facility that the Mouse is more accurate than a Controller. Even with joystick extenders.

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Teem_Rocket:

How is this even a debate? Mouse pointing is SO much more accurate than joysticks.

It’s a personal preference, that’s how it’s debatable. If I were being forced to use a mouse rather than a controller, my K/D ratio on Black Ops 2 would most likely be around a 1.25 or so, and right now it’s 2.07.

item.title: Xbox 360 Controller VS Mouse n Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

For some games it’s necessary (Castle Crashers, Super Meat Boy, Lego Star Wars/Indiana Jones/Harry Potter, etc), but for any first person shooter I prefer mouse and keyboard any day. I find a mouse much more accurate than a controller, and once you’ve got used to using a mouse and keyboard, the controller just feels wrong.

Read full topic
